intro: Callilepis, commonly known as the African mountain heath, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related plants. The genus comprises several species, many of which are shrubs characterized by their dense, evergreen foliage. Callilepis plants typically thrive in rocky, well-drained soils and are adapted to high-altitude environments. They produce small, tubular flowers that are often brightly colored, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds.
